#summary Frequently Asked Questions
<dl>
<dt>*How does Cloudy Calculator work?*
<dd>It's mostly magic. If Cloudy Calculator can't handle a calculation, it asks Google for the result (you'll see a litte "G" to the left of those calculations).

<dt>*Why don't I see any result when I press "="?*
<dd>To get a result, you must press _Enter_. You can add an "=" to the end of an expression, but it is not necessary.

<dt>*What kinds of calculations is Cloudy Calculator capable of?*
<dd>Since Cloudy Calculator uses Google's calculator feature, it can do anything [http://www.google.com/help/calculator.html Google calculator] can do. It can also handle quite a few Wolfram|Alpha queries.

<dt>*What kinds of names are allowed for user variables?*
<dd>User variables must start with an "@" sign followed by one or more letters, numbers, or underscores. The "@" variable is reserved for storing the most recent result.

<dt>*Why the name change from "Chromey" to "Cloudy"?*
<dd>Google made us change it.
